did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Faculty and professional papers of Walter Isard (1919-2010), Economist and Peace Scientist. Includes records of professional organizations which he founded, including the Regional Science Association (RSA), Peace Research Society International and Peace Science Society International (PSSI).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Cornell professor of Economics (Regional Science and Peace Science) from 1979-2010. Also taught at Harvard, MIT and the University of Pennsylvania.
Founded the Regional Science Association (RSA) and Peace Science Society International (PSSI) and was the director and program chair for Economists Allied for Arms Reduction (ECAAR).
Graduated from Temple University (A.B., 1939) and Harvard (M.A., 1941; PhD, 1943)

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Records related to Walter Isard’s career.

Material from professional organizations, especially the Regional Science Association and Peace Science Society International. Includes correspondence, administrative records, reports, and conference programs and papers, and publications such as the Journal of the RSA, Papers, and the Journal of Peace Science.

Records from his role as faculty at Cornell, Harvard, MIT and the University of Pennsylvania, including course materials and students' theses. Includes articles assembled for research, his notes, and drafts of his books and papers.
Also, a CD containing photos of Isard.
Commonly used acronyms/abbreviations include the following:

list.item: ECAAR: Economists Allied for Arms Reduction (formerly Economists Against the Arms Race)
PEPS: Peace Economics and Peace Science (journal)
WAAS: World Academy of Arts and Sciences

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged as follows. Please note that some boxes contain multiple series. Original folder titles have been retained.
General professional correspondence, as arranged by Isard

p.emph: SERIES III. PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS, CONFERENCES AND INVOLVEMENT:

arrangement.p: Includes correspondence, journals, conference materials, and administrative documents including memoranda, agendas, and financial records. Especially includes material from the Regional Science Association and the Peace Science Society International.

p.emph: SERIES IV. RESEARCH, DRAFTS AND GRANTS:

arrangement.p: Includes articles assembled by Isard for his research, his research notes, and drafts and manuscripts of his books, papers and presentations. Also includes materials related to research funding.

p.emph: SERIES V. TEACHING, ADVISING AND ADMINISTRATION:

arrangement.p: Includes Isard’s correspondence with students, course materials such as syllabi, lecture notes, and material related to administration. This material is mostly from his time at Cornell, but also includes materials from Harvard, the University of Pennsylvania and MIT.
Boxes of varying content, which alphabetized Isard by folder title. Including correspondence, research, professional materials, teaching/advising materials etc.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Walter Isard papers, #3959. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
